In a message dated 8/17/01 6:27:51 PM Pacific Daylight Time, 
thecode@... writes:

<< OOC: And I suppose guys like Jericho, the Hardyz, and the Rock do have 
talent just because they are booked to win all of their matches. (Chokes the 
hell out of the WWF. Turns around and chokes the hell out of Test) >>

(I recall many a match they have lost.  But no, all four of those WWF members 
you listed would still talent even if they lost every match against the 
'Alliance', coincidentally a name for two major evils IRL and IC :).  
Alliance members have no talent, save the WWF superstars that went over to 
it.  They pretty much have no charisma, the WWF superstars do.  Tajiri alone 
is more colorful than every WCW combined, save Booker T.  Booker T. has some, 
but with moves like the spinerooni, to me, he's just a joke.  Especially 
since he's copying the rock bottom and giving it some name like the "book 
in".  How the hell does Booker come up with such lame names?  Good Leppard...

Watching WCW on cable, when it was on, caused me to fall asleep.  Good 
Leppard, how it was boring.  Bringing in those wrestlers who did no 
interesting moves.  The announcers were as irritating as Paul Heyman's voice. 
 The referees were as bland as the WCW 'superstars'.  That's why it should've 
been called "We Can't Wrestle".

"Robert Van Dam is a rising athlete."  Sorry, but I don't like wrestlers 
being shoved down my throat to try and make me like them.  It's bad enough 
his costume sucks, much like all of the WCW and its intros.  Heh, probably 
the best fighter in the Alliance is Shane O'Mac and that's because he's WWF 
material. 

The Rock is the greatest wrestler ever.  He isn't shoved down people's 
throats, he has more charisma than anyone, he's funny, and best of all, he's 
got killer moves and could kick anyone's ass in real life.  I know someone 
might say "the Rock is being crammed down my throat" so I just wanted to say 
that.  Anyone who disagrees is just plain in the grip of idiocy.

Has there ever been a good WCW coming over to the WWF?  Not really.  The 
Radicalz? Nah.  Benoit, Guerrero, and that fat guy who kept acting like a 
Casa Nova, no.  Perry Saturn...he's not a good wrestler but he's funny with 
his insane act.  We needed someone to replace Al Snow in that department.

ECW has had several good wrestlers come over.  Tazz, Rhyno, and the Dudley 
Boyz.  But the Alliance still sucks.  That's why the script had WWF 
superstars go over there.  WCW losers fighting the WWF?  Ha!  Kane and 
Undertaker could take 'em all out.  

Booker T's been WCW champion five times?  Wow.  Rock's been WWF champion six 
times.  And a WWF title is worth five WCW titles.  I had an earlier 
conversation about this over IM, wish I'd saved it so I could just copy and 
paste.)

- L. Unitron
